title: Computer Vision - Pre Unit Survey for Teachers

elements.name: survey_preamble_header_and_text
elements.html:
Welcome to Code.org's Computer Vision - Pre-Unit Survey

Code.org relies on surveys as a crucial tool to remain connected to teachers, and to give you the opportunity to provide feedback about your experience teaching our curriculum.

The purpose of this survey is to understand better who our teachers are, their motivation to teach Code.org's Computer Vision unit, and their previous experience with this content and tools. 

Privacy and Confidentiality

  • Your individual responses here are completely confidential.
  • Your identity will never be revealed publicly or used to tie any responses back to you personally.
  • We may share de-identified, aggregate data (representing all responses) publicly.
  • Your de-identified responses will be used by Code.org to improve our curriculum and programs.

This survey should take less than 5 minutes to complete.  Your complete honesty and candor are appreciated.

elements.name: teaching_background_header
elements.html:
Your Background

We'd like to get to know you and your expectations for teaching this unit. Please share with us a little bit about you and your background.

choices.text: Computer Science teacher
Classroom teacher
STEM / Technology teacher
Librarian / school media specialist
Other

choices.text: I have not taught Computer Science before
Less than one year

Between 3 and 5 years
More than 5 years

elements.name: teaching_experience_computer_vision

choices.text: Yes
No

elements.name: teaching_experience_computer_vision_details
elements.title: Please describe briefly the computer vision content you have taught and context in which you taught it.

elements.name: module_expectations_header
elements.html:
Your Goals and Expectations

Please share with us what drives you to teach this unit and what barriers do you anticipate.

elements.name: module_goals
elements.title: What are your primary goals in teaching this unit?

choices.text: Enhance students' understanding of computer vision and AI concepts.
Stimulate interest in CS careers among students.
Develop critical thinking and problem-solving abilities.
Integrate ethical considerations of technology use into students' learning.
Encourage creativity and innovation in project work.
Other.

elements.name: module_goals_other_comment
elements.title: Please describe what other goal do you have for this unit.

elements.name: module_challenges
elements.title: What challenges do you anticipate in teaching this unit?

choices.text: Lack of student interest or motivation.
Difficulty in developing my own understanding or teaching complex concepts.
Time constraints within the academic calendar.
Managing diverse learning speeds and styles within the classroom.
Other.

elements.name: module_challenges_other_comment
elements.title: Please describe what other challenges you anticipate for this unit.

choices.text: Lack of student interest or motivation.

elements.html:
Thank You!

Thanks from Code.org for your time, thoughts, and passion for teaching.
